teal.sim.engine

Class SimEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • teal.core.AbstractElement
      • teal.sim.engine.SimEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, HasID, TElement, THasPropertyChange, Integratable, RenderListener, TEngine, TEngineControl, TSimEngine
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EMEngine

    public class SimEngine
extends AbstractElement
implements TSimEngine, Integratable
    SimEngine is the central simulation engine.

    All entities that can potentially interact with the simulation engine will be collectively labeled as the engine's clients. The typical clients of the engine are:

    - The user.

    - The application.

    - The viewer.

    When an application is constructed, the engine must be notified of all TSimElement objects to be included in the simulation, which it compartmentalizes into lists of specific families. The engine naturally properly manages removals as well, if these objects need to be removed later in the simulation.

    Clients, and specifically the application, and its user, control the engine primarily through a EngineControl object. The SimEngineControl instance of the latter is architectured to contain the thread object within which the engine runs. As such, it can directly initialize, start, step, stop and reset the simulation. These actions are triggered through control methods, which place the engine in one of several states, enumerated in EngineControl.

    The simulation state controls the flow within the run loop of the engine.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • nbDependentValues

        protected int nbDependentValues
        Indicates the number of dependent variables that are to be integrated. Used during Runge-Kutta numerical integration.
        See Also:
        RungeKutta4

      • simState

        protected int simState
        Simulation state variable, takes any of the possible state values described in EngineControl. A client modifies this state only through an object of the latter type. The state governs the flow of the main loop in run.
        See Also:
        TEngineControl.NOT, TEngineControl.INIT, TEngineControl.RUNNING, TEngineControl.PAUSED, TEngineControl.ENDED, run()

      • waiting

        protected boolean waiting
        Additional simulation state variable triggered in circumstances when the run loop should temporarily suspend regular operation when in EngineControl.RUNNING mode, and instead stay idle, and consitently yield the engine thread. Such measures are necessary when, for instance, doing step-by-step simulation. Development note: there might be a way to altogether avoid using waiting mode by properly synchronyzing all methods which might interfere with the run loop.
        See Also:
        TEngineControl.RUNNING, run(), nextStep()

      • mNeedsSpatial

        protected boolean mNeedsSpatial
        Spatial processing, as performed by doSpatial is only performed when this variable is true. This only happens when spatial processing is properly requested through requestSpatial.

      • mNeedsRefresh

        protected boolean mNeedsRefresh
        Refresh processing, as executed by doRefresh is only performed when this flag is set to true. This only happens when spatial processing is properly requested through requestSpatial.

      • mNeedsReorder

        protected boolean mNeedsReorder
        Reorder processing, as executed by doReorder is only performed when this flag is set to true. This only happens when reorder processing is properly requested through requestReorder.

      • reorderTagged

        java.util.ArrayList reorderTagged
        List of all objects that are tagged as the prime causes for the reordering request. The list is used to specify priorities within the reordering algorithm.
        See Also:
        requestReorder(HasCollisionController), resolveReorder()

      • delay

        protected long delay
        delay is the short time in milliseconds the thread waits after every simulation cycle before starting the next cycle.

      • padDelay

        protected long padDelay
        The amount of time in milliseconds that the run loop sleeps after a frame is computed, so that the frame rate stays as adjusted, when the engine is in the EngineControl.RUNNING state.
        See Also:
        run()

      • idleDelay

        protected long idleDelay
        The amount of time in milleseconds that the run loop sleeps when the engine is initialized, but is not in the EngineControl.RUNNING state.
        See Also:
        run()

      • time

        protected double time
        The engine time. Time is the independent variable in all the numerical integrations within the engine.

      • deltaTime

        protected double deltaTime
        The simulation step size. During each dynamic cycle, the simulation advances by deltaTime.
        See Also:
        doDynamic()

      • frame

        private long frame
        Frame count variable. Calculates the number of simulation frames computed at any point in the simulation.
        See Also:
        nextStep(), run()

      • isCheckingRate

        protected boolean isCheckingRate

      • frameDelay

        protected long frameDelay
        The amount of time in milliseconds between two consecutive frames. This time includes both the frame computation, and any additional padded delay that is added to maintain the desired frame rate.
        See Also:
        padDelay

      • showtime

        private boolean showtime
        Flag which triggers displaying the simulation time at every frame.

      • threadStarted

        private boolean threadStarted
        Flag which indicates that the engine thread has started. It is initially set to false, and only set to true once the run loop is entered.

      • toAddList

        private java.util.ArrayList toAddList
        List of objects scheduled for addition in the beginning of the run loop. This is part of a system which prevents additions and removals of objects to and from the engine during the frame computatation.
        See Also:
        run()

      • toRemoveList

        private java.util.ArrayList toRemoveList
        List of objects scheduled for removal in the beginning of the run loop. This is part of a system which prevents additions and removals of objects to and from the engine during the frame computatation.
        See Also:
        run()

        private boolean isIntegrating

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimEngine

        public SimEngine()
        Default constructor of the engine.

        The following steps are carried out:

        - The default AbstractElement ID is set to "theEngine".

        - The simulation state is initialized to EngineControl.NOT.

        - The default simulation step size is set to 1 sec.

        - No title is assigned to the simulation.

        - Object lists are created.

        - Default spatial bounds of the simulation are set.

        - Gravitational, magnetic, electric, and Pauli composite fields are initialized.

      • SimEngine

        public SimEngine(java.lang.String idStr)
        Calls the default constructor, but overrides the default AbstractElement ID by the specified one.
        Parameters:
        idStr -

        public boolean isIntegrating()
        Always returns true, as the engine is always integrating. The fact that the engine implements Integratable itself is to facilitate using RungeKutta4.

      • setDependentValues

        public void setDependentValues(double[] newDepValues,
                               int offset)
        The setDependentValues method of the world now incorporates a special meta-integration section which resolves the interdependencies between object variables that are not explicitly dependent variables, such as the current in a ring. The simplistic method of successive iterations is capable of yielding acceptable solution in most cases, but might diverge as well. When that happens in the case of the ring, the result is a large jump in current. A possible remedy would be the implementation of a Newton-Raphson family method.
        Specified by:
        setDependentValues in interface Integratable

      • doDynamic

        protected void doDynamic()
        Computes the next step of the World, this procedure is used by the World Dynamic behavior, the World calculates the nextStep of each Integratable object and stores the new values into shadow values. At every step of the world this method is called :
        It compute the next values of all the parameters of all the objects

      • checkCollisions

        public int checkCollisions()
        This method checks for collisions between all colliding objects in the simulation and returns a value representing the type of collisions detected (COLLISION, NOCOLLISION, ADHERENCE, or INTERPENETRATION). Only one instance of INTERPENETRATION is required to return that result, as it guarantees that the simulation will have to enter "time reduction mode" to resolve the collision(s).
        Returns:
        flag indicating collision state detected.

      • requestReorder

        public void requestReorder(HasCollisionController x)
        Requests a Reorder on the supplied colliding object. A Reorder ensures that the supplied object does not overlap any other objects in the world due to USER INTERACTION (as opposed to simulated motion, which is resolved by the collision detection mechanism).
        Parameters:
        x - object to Reorder.

      • doReorder

        void doReorder()
        Reordering is the action of resolving spatial overlaps of physical objects by systematic repositioning. These overlaps are not those induced by collision, in which case we refer to the situation as interpenetration, but are due either to a random initialization or a user dragging a physical objects onto another. A reordering is performed only if the client

      • resolveReorder

        private boolean resolveReorder()

      • doStepping

        protected void doStepping(double effectiveDeltaTime)
        Calls the nextStep method of all elements in the Stepping list.

      • doSpatial

        protected void doSpatial()
        Calls the nextSpatial method of all elements in the spatialObjs list. The execution is performed conditionally if the mNeedsSpatial flag is set to true. This flag is reset after the method is executed.

      • update

        protected void update()
        Calls the update method of all elements in the TUpdatable list. Most implementations of the update method will involve setting the published values of the dependent variables within the given object, to the shadow values, which are temporary values maintained throughout the integration or reordering processes.
        See Also:
        run(), doReorder()

      • addSimElement

        public void addSimElement(TSimElement obj)
        Run-time object addition to the world is now handled by requst. If the world thread has started [threadStarted, a flag set from within run()], addition occurs at the start of the run loop. Otherwise, the objects are added immediately.

        * Info from old addSimElement(TSimElement): Used to add a SimElement to the simulation, the SimElement list and all object type specific lists.

        * Info from old addSimElement(TSimElement, boolean): Used to add an SimElement to the simulation, the simElement list now only maintains a local ccopy for ease in clearing the world. The maintanance of the general element list has been moved to TEALapplet.

        Specified by:
        addSimElement in interface TSimEngine
        Parameters:
        obj -

      • triggerRender

        protected void triggerRender()
        Posts a postId to renderBehavior, which wakes up and iterates over all viewers, invoking each one's render method. If renderBehavior is null, then the iteration is performed directly here.
